intro: Alchemilla argyrophylla var. thorei, commonly known as silverleaf lady's mantle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe. It features basal rosettes of silver-gray, fuzzy leaves that are covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces upright, branched stems that bear small, greenish-white flowers in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodland areas or along stream banks. Its leaves and flowers are used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported soothing and anti-inflammatory properties.
